@fyskij okay. There's a lot of repeated code and it's easily dryable, define_method is your friend. I'd also look into abstracting the api access to HTTP so you can easily replace it with different backends if the need rises. You can namespace the methods dropped into the class, which would get those details outside of that single method. That's just what I do generally. It also makes it easier to test so you're not having to deal with crazy expectations.
